#Text=Football : Bayern beats Borussia Dortmund 5-4 on penalties to win German Super
#Text=Cup
#Text=Sunday , August 6 , 2017

#Text=Yesterday , in the German DFL-Supercup final , defending Bundesliga champions Bayern Munich defeated DFB Pokal cup winners Borussia Dortmund 5 – 4 in the penalty shootout to win the title at Dortmund 's stadium Signal Iduna Park , after the full time ended in a 2 – 2 draw .
#Text=Bayern Munich lifting their sixth DFL-Super Cup trophy Image : FC Bayern .
#Text=Dortmund got an early lead in the game as their winger Christian Pulisic opened the scoring in the 12th minute of the game .
#Text=Pulisic got the ball from Bayern Munich defender Javi Martínez and scored the first goal of the match .
#Text=18-year-old Pulisic became the youngest goalscorer in the competition history .
#Text=Six minutes later , Bayern equalized as striker Robert Lewandowski scored a close range tap-in from Joshua Kimmich 's assist .
#Text=The first half ended with 1 – 1 on the scoreboard .
#Text=Dortmund 's Sokratis Papastathopoulos was the only player to be booked in the first half .
#Text=After the half time , Dortmund 's Sebastian Rode was substituted in for Mahmoud Dahoud .
#Text=Later , Bayern made two changes .
#Text=In the 71st minute , Dortmund 's striker Pierre-Emerick Augameyang scored the second goal for Borussia , chipping over Bayern 's goalkeeper Sven Ulreich , restoring Dortmund 's lead .

#Text=With the 2 – 1 on the scoreboard , the match seemed to to end with Dortmund as the winner , but in the 88th minute , Dortmund 's Łukasz Piszczek scored an own goal , as the final time finished with a 2 – 2 draw , and the game proceeded to penalty shootouts .
#Text=Robert Lewandowski took the first kick for Bayern and converted it into goal .
#Text=Joshua Kimmich 's kick was saved by Dortmund 's goalkeeper Roman Bürki while Rode was denied by Sven Ulreich .
#Text=The score reached a tie of 4 – 4 .
#Text=Ulreich stopped Marc Bartra 's kick as Bayern won their sixth Supercup title .
#Text=Dortmund had 48 % ball possession in the match , with 434 passes .
#Text=Bayern had 52 % ball possession , with five on target shoots of thirteen attempts .
#Text=A total 30 fouls were committed in the match and six players were shown yellow cards .
#Text=Bayern 's coach , Carlo Ancelotti , congratulated the team and tweeted , " Proud of your effort .
